translated: The Elder Mañcadāyaka’s Birth Story🔽When the compassionate one,
the perfected one, the leader of the world, had attained final Nibbāna,
and gods and humans were venerating it.
and by that I supported my children.
with faith in my own hands,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Having gone to the world of the gods,
I rejoice in the company of the Thirty-three;

translated: appear as I wish.🔽Fifty times I was Sakka, king of the gods,🔽and ruled as king of the gods;
Eighty times I was a king,
this is the fruit of giving a seat.
Having fallen from the world of the gods,
If I were to go to a human existence,
The great gifts and fine beds
Would be mine all by myself.
My final birth is now being lived;
Even today at the time of lying down,
The bed is set out for me.
I do not know of a bad destination,
This is the fruit of the gift of a bed.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
